[John Lemmon]81-john lemmon , thank [you]305-you for driving [me]0-i to [State Street]2-state street a few days before Christmas , dropping to one knee , and asking [me]0-i to be [[your]305-you bride]307-your bride . [I]0-i ’ve never once regretted saying yes .

Chapter 1The [Van Heusen Hotel]18-the van heusen hotel]309-everyone at forever romance who had a part in editing , designing , and producing this book . as always , thank you to my friends and family and my dear husband , who have to deal with me during deadline time . i ’m so lucky you all love me enough to put up with me ! chapter 1the van heusen hotel was the love of [Merina Van Heusen]84-merina ’s life . [The historical building]313-the historical building dominated [the corner of [Rush]4-rush and [East Chicago Avenue]5-east chicago avenue]314-the corner of rush and east chicago avenue , regal and beautiful , a living work of art . [[[Her]84-merina parents]315-her parents ’ hotel]316-her parents ’ hotel had once been [the Bell Terrace]6-the bell terrace , home away from home to celebrities such as [Audrey Hepburn]85-audrey hepburn , [Sammy Davis Jr.]86-sammy davis jr. , and more recently , [Lady Gaga]87-lady gaga and [the late Robin Williams]173-bobbie . [The original structure]317-the original structure perished in the Great [Chicago]7-chicago Fire of 1871 , only to be resurrected bigger , better , and more beautiful . There was a life lesson in there . Latte in hand , [Merina]84-merina breathed in the air in [the lobby]318-the lobby , a mix of vanilla and cinnamon . Faint but reminiscent of the famed dessert invented in [[the hotel]319-the hotel ’s kitchen]320-the hotel ’s kitchen : the snickerdoodle . On [her]84-merina way past [Arnold]89-arnold , who stood checking [a guest]321-a guest into [the hotel]319-the hotel , [she]84-merina snagged one of the fresh - baked cookies off a plate and winked at [him]89-arnold . [The dark - skinned older man]323-the dark - skinned older man slid [her]84-merina a smile and winked back . Having practically grown up [here]324-here , [the VH]8-the vh was [a second home to [her]84-merina]325-a second home to her . [Arnold]89-arnold had started out as [a bellman]326-a bellman and had worked [here]324-here for as long [she]84-merina could remember . [He]89-arnold was as good as [family]311-family . [She]84-merina dumped [her]84-merina purse in [[her]84-merina office]329-her office and finished [her]84-merina cookie , holding on to the latte while [she]84-merina meandered down [the hallways]330-the hallways , checking to make sure there were no trays outside the doors that needed collecting . Then had to call again to be heard over the sound . When [she]84-merina came into view , [he]333-a man outside one of the rooms paused the drilling and looked up at [her]84-merina . [He]333-a man outside one of the rooms wore a tool belt and navy uniform , and the antique doorknob was sitting on the floor at [his]333-a man outside one of the rooms feet along with a small pile of sawdust . “What are [you]333-a man outside one of the rooms doing ? ”[84-merina] [she]84-merina asked , bending to pick up the heavy brass . [[Her]84-merina mother]341-her mother acted as if selling it was nothing more than an inconvenience . [Focus]102-focus . [You]2260-you ’re pissed at [Crane]101-reese . Right . [She]84-merina would n’t be surprised if [he]2277-his slept right at [his]2277-his desk , snuggling [his]2277-his cell phone in one hand and a wad of money in the other . [Stupid billionaires]2281-stupid billionaires . Inside , [she]84-merina sucked in a generous breath and shook off [her]84-merina chill . At least there was no wind , and despite the chilling whitewash of furniture , rugs , and modern lighting , it was warm . But only in temperature . [The Crane]101-reese represented everything [she]84-merina hated about [modern hotels]2282-modern hotels . And [she]84-merina should know , because [she]84-merina ’d worked diligently alongside [[her]84-merina parents]315-her parents to keep the integrity of [[their]315-her parents boutique hotel]2284-their boutique hotel since [she]84-merina started running [it]101-reese . [[Her]84-merina hotel]2285-her hotel was [a place of rich history , beauty , and passion]2286-a place of rich history , beauty , and passion . Perfect for the likes of [Reese Crane]101-reese . [She]84-merina walked through [the lobby]318-the lobby , filled to overflowing with [businesspeople of every color , shape , and size]2292-businesspeople of every color , shape , and size . Flashes of suits — black , gray , white — passed in a monochrome blur , as if [the Crane Hotel]2262-the crane hotel had a dress code and [each and every guest here]2294-each and every guest here had received the memo . [Merina]84-merina , in [her]84-merina plum silk shirt and dark gray pencil skirt and nude heels , did n’t stand out … except for the fact that [she]84-merina resembled a drowned rat . Chapter 13Monday morning , [Reese]101-reese surfaced from sleep when a soft sigh paired with tugging the covers from [his]1458-he shoulder reminded [him]1458-he that [he]1458-he had company . [He]1458-he usually slept on the couch next to the bed , save for the time after [Merina]84-merina had gone down on [him]1458-he and left [him]1458-he prostrate and dead to [the world]2254-the world . Chapter 16CRANE HOTELS NAMES [REESE CRANE CEO.The]253-reese headline in the Tribune was n’t as splashy as what the gossip rags had been writing about [him]96-alex , but that large black print may well have been a golden road leading straight to heaven . [The board]2388-the board had taken nearly as long to announce as it took [them]2388-the board to reach the damn decision . It ’d been two weeks since [[his]96-alex father]2387-his father told [him]96-alex the news and the article appeared in the paper just today . [He’d]96-alex been desperate when [he]96-alex ’d concocted the idea of marrying [Merina]84-merina . Fully prepared to prove to the board [he]96-alex could settle down and be viewed as responsible enough to run [the company [he]96-alex ’d already been running]1827-the company he ’d already been running at [[his]96-alex father]2387-his father ’s side for years . Six months , and [he]96-alex knew [he]96-alex could convince [them]2388-the board . But it did n’t take that long . Because [he]96-alex and [Merina]84-merina delivered Oscar - worthy performances ? Or because of something much scarier : [They]2388-the board were no longer performing . Chapter 18City lights moved outside the tinted windows on the quiet ride back from [[her]84-merina parents]315-her parents ’ anniversary party . Sort of . Loss should never be “[109-tag] acceptable . ”The board had started talking about wanting to increase profits in [the hotel bars]3883-the hotel bars last year , but [they]3884-they ’d downgraded [their]3884-they assessment since [Tag]109-tag brought up the idea of upgrading [the bars]3885-the bars nationwide . [He]109-tag ’d stepped up with an announcement that [he]109-tag was going to fix the bar issue , and [the board]2388-the board had shrugged , stated it was not necessary , and then moved forth with [their]2388-the board agenda . [He]109-tag also wedged [his]109-tag wide shoulders into an uncomfortable button - down and wrapped [his]109-tag bulky thighs in trousers . [He]109-tag felt … wrong . Not [himself]109-tag .
